title: I'm Manifesting Chic Winter Outfits—30 Affordable and Stylish Walmart Finds That Fit the Bill
excerpt: These 30 chic winter fashion picks from Walmart span from stylish sweaters to pretty dresses to cool jeans and everything in between.
text: The Walmart fashion section is top-notch, so I couldn't help but beeline over to the new arrivals section to check out the latest. Soon after I started browsing, I found a selection of classic everyday pieces like cool jeans but also a stylish selection of trendy pieces that are perfect for the holiday season and winter, in general.Some of the standout finds that I came across are cozy sweaters and party-ready dresses. I was also drawn to a variety of effortless outerwear. The shoes? I want them all—they instantly elevate any look and can be worn for many seasons to come. Did I mention just about everything I found is under $50?Keep scrolling to shop 30 affordable and stylish Walmart finds that are guaranteed to come together to create an array of chic winter outfits. Scoop Faux Fur Oversized Maxi Coat Any outfit will look instantly cooler. No Boundaries Fairisle Jacquard Pullover and Beanie Set No Boundaries Cozy Lug Sole Ankle Boots These go with everything from jeans to maxi dresses. Levi Strauss Signature Heritage High Rise Straight Jean Scoop Satin Bomber Jacket This jacket adds a luxe touch. Time and Tru Ashlyn Shoulder Handbag Red accessories are trending. The styling possibilities are endless. Madden NYC Slingback Kitten Heel With Bow Slingbacks to elevate your ensemble. Scoop Ultimate Crepe Slouchy Double Breasted Blazer Camel outerwear always looks polished. The denim trend of the moment. Whippy Leather Belt With Double Ring Buckle A cool belt to complete the look. Sofia Jeans by Sofia Vergara Sleeveless Open Back Midi Dress Perfect for a winter wedding. Time and Tru Lurex Sweater With Long Sleeves An effortless sweater pick. Sofia Jeans by Sofia Vergara Eden Slim Straight Super High Rise Jeans Great inspo for how to dress up jeans. Suede shoes give expensive vibes. Time and Tru Faux Wool Solid Button Front Coat This black coat is a no-brainer. Scoop Metallic Knit Mini Flare Dress Into this party-ready dress. Cupshe Tweed Button-Front Mini Skirt Tweed pieces are top of mind. Madden Girl Dicee Kitten Heel Knee High Boots Knee-high boots that are under $100? Yes, please. Time and Tru Bonded Faux Shearling Bomber Jacket This jacket is giving expensive vibes. Scoop Stovepipe High Rise Straight Leg Jeans Another standout pair of jeans. Scoop Seamless Mock Neck Bodysuit With Long Sleeves The definition of a closet staple. Time and Tru Buckle Clogs Great for cozy everyday looks. Time and Tru Velvet Wide Leg Pants Velvet pants are perfect for the holiday season. Nine.Eight V-Neck Satin Midi Dress With Long Sleeves Chic-little-black-dress alert. Free Assembly Fair Isle Cardigan Sweater Another stylish Fair Isle pick. Burgundy bags are having a moment. Lee Flex Motion Relaxed Fit Straight Leg Jean This whole look is a winner. Madden NYC Tall Moto Buckle Boots Perfect for getting a cool model-off-duty feel. Time and Tru Sequin Skirt With Side Slit This understated sequin skirt caught my eye. Jennifer Camp Forbes is currently an editor at Who What Wear, where she has worked in a variety of capacities for over a decade, including creative director and various editor roles. She’s well-known as a shopping expert that’s sought out for advice and insight on the latest trends, outfit ideas, and fashion picks thanks to her thoughtful shopping roundups, digital moodboards, and extensive knowledge of up-and-coming brands, plus the new arrivals sections of the chicest retailers. Jennifer has had a lifelong interest in fashion which led her to intern at Harper’s Bazaar as an undergraduate. Later, while working towards her masters degree in psychological counseling at Columbia University, she founded two digital fashion publications: Le Fashion and Olsens Anonymous. The popularity of both sites grew and after graduation she decided put her plans to become a therapist aside to pursue a career in fashion. While she has called Los Angeles and New York City home in the past, she currently works remotely from Massachusetts. When she’s not obsessing over and writing about her latest fashion finds, she is delighting in raising two little ones with her highschool sweetheart, perusing TikTok religiously, listening to podcasts and audiobooks, creating abstract photographs, and eating the best Mexican food she can get her hands on.
html:
The Walmart fashion section is top-notch, so I couldn't help but beeline over to the new arrivals section to check out the latest. Soon after I started browsing, I found a selection of classic everyday pieces like cool jeans but also a stylish selection of trendy pieces that are perfect for the holiday season and winter, in general.

Some of the standout finds that I came across are cozy sweaters and party-ready dresses. I was also drawn to a variety of effortless outerwear. The shoes? I want them all—they instantly elevate any look and can be worn for many seasons to come. Did I mention just about everything I found is under $50?

Keep scrolling to shop 30 affordable and stylish Walmart finds that are guaranteed to come together to create an array of chic winter outfits.

Scoop

Faux Fur Oversized Maxi Coat

Any outfit will look instantly cooler.

These go with everything from jeans to maxi dresses.

Jennifer Camp Forbes is currently an editor at Who What Wear, where she has worked in a variety of capacities for over a decade, including creative director and various editor roles. She’s well-known as a shopping expert that’s sought out for advice and insight on the latest trends, outfit ideas, and fashion picks thanks to her thoughtful shopping roundups, digital moodboards, and extensive knowledge of up-and-coming brands, plus the new arrivals sections of the chicest retailers. Jennifer has had a lifelong interest in fashion which led her to intern at Harper’s Bazaar as an undergraduate. Later, while working towards her masters degree in psychological counseling at Columbia University, she founded two digital fashion publications: Le Fashion and Olsens Anonymous. The popularity of both sites grew and after graduation she decided put her plans to become a therapist aside to pursue a career in fashion. While she has called Los Angeles and New York City home in the past, she currently works remotely from Massachusetts. When she’s not obsessing over and writing about her latest fashion finds, she is delighting in raising two little ones with her highschool sweetheart, perusing TikTok religiously, listening to podcasts and audiobooks, creating abstract photographs, and eating the best Mexican food she can get her hands on.
